Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw a fish and another type of living thing in their habitat.
The student can label where the fish lives (e.g., pond, river, ocean) and show other animals or plants that live there too.
The student can show and label what the fish needs to survive, such as water and food.
The student can draw and label parts of the habitat that provide resources for the fish and other living things (e.g., water, plants).
The student can illustrate and explain how the fish's habitat helps it meet its needs (e.g., fish live in water environments).
The student can demonstrate in the drawing that the fish, other living things, and their habitat work together as a system to meet each other's needs.
